title: Writing the Matrix
text: Each row corresponds to an equation, and the fourth column is separated by the equal sign. We have: $$4x-3y+3z=-1$$, $$x+2y-z=2$$, $$-2x-y+3z=-4$$
speech: Each row corresponds to an equation, and the fourth column is separated by the equal sign. We have:  4 x minus 3 y plus 3 z is equal to negative 1 ,  x, plus 2 y minus z is equal to 2 ,  negative 2 x minus y plus 3 z is equal to negative 4
pacedSpeech: Each row corresponds to an equation, and the fourth column is separated by the equal sign. We have:   4 x minus 3 y plus 3 z is equal to negative 1
,   x, plus 2 y minus z is equal to 2
,   negative 2 x minus y plus 3 z is equal to negative 4
